channel.title: Ultimate Marvel Universe (Post Ultimatum) on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Ultimate Marvel Universe (Post Ultimatum) on jverkamp.com

item.title: Ultimate FF: Strangest Ever
item.description:
Fantastic Four?

Nah, Future Foundation!

Itâ€™s a really weird story.

Random incursions from random dimensions. Animal people. Cyclops super heroes. Atlanteans.

And oy talk about tonal whiplash. Death and doom to animal people to kidnapping to quippy one liners to rape. All over the place.

And finally, the art. It starts off, a bit unfinishedâ€¦ but I kind of like it. But then it gets even more unfinished and cartoony. Not a fan.

Overall, a vaguely interesting story wrapped up in a lot of weird.

Not surprised this is all it got.

Onward!

item.title: Cataclysm: The Ultimates' Last Stand
item.description:
Another giant story; the second ‘biggest’ of the Ultimate Marvel Universe

Uh oh. Gah Lak Tus? Time to meet GALACTUS!

Iâ€™m sure this will go well.

Being titled Cataclysmâ€”and the last in the Ultimate Marvel Universe lineâ€”after all.

The X-Menâ€™s involvement? Meh.

Spider-Man? Pretty awesome. Touching and personal, even in the face of a giant purple guy with a fancy hat.

The Ultimates: what is with that art style? Everyone getting infected with Galactus is amusing. Purple Hulk!

The Ultimates Last Stand? The meat of the story.

Reed Richard’s redemption arc (of a sort)? What… he does not deserve that.

Itâ€™s kind of a deus ex solution to an impossible problem. But thatâ€™s sort of the way with comics.

Or â€¦ maybe it is?

item.title: Ultimate Comics Spider-Man by Brian Michael Bendis, Volume 5
item.description:
One Year Later.

Miles is done.

But then (Ultimate) Cloak and Dagger show up:

Origin story and all.

Crazy comic action. Touching family scenes. Motivational speeches. Itâ€™s really good.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Ultimates: Disassembled
item.description:
Who would be the absolute worst person in the Ultimate Universe to get the Infinity Stones?

Worse than that.

Nowâ€¦ both at once.

Itâ€™s a pretty crazy volume with some interesting twists and some big action pieces.

But really, itâ€™s just the beginning of the end. Cataclysm is coming.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics: X-Men, by Brian Wood, Volume 3
item.description:
Two mutant homelands, Tian and Utopia. Well, apparently you canâ€™t have thatâ€¦

Jean has never been the most stable personality, at last not in the Ultimate Universe. Andâ€¦ I get it. So much power, so young. And yetâ€¦ she keeps causing more issues again and again. Oy.

It all seems so sudden to escalate. And then in the way of comicsâ€”so suddenly over.

Oh and apparently the Sentient Seed dies again? Not sure what the point of that was either way.

So it goes.

Onward.

item.title: Ultimate Comics: Iron Man
item.description:
So much continues to change in the Post-Wave world…

So instead letâ€™s introduce some new foe in the Mandarin. Hacking in and taking over Stark Tech. The Iron Man suit.

Neat idea but feels incomplete. Both in what I expected post Ultimatum and in the resolution.

Onward.

item.title: Ultimate Comics: X-Men, by Brian Wood, Volume 2
item.description:
Utopia.

Turns out, pretending the Sentient Seed died out lastedâ€¦ not at all. Now thereâ€™s a new Mutant homeland in Americaâ€¦

Thatâ€™s actually really cool.

Of course Tian isnâ€™t thrilled by the competition. Itâ€™s kind of amazing that after so long, Jean is still around. This has potentialâ€¦ but sheâ€™s starting with lies. Iâ€™m sure it will go well. Especially if sheâ€™s both hiding and going by her original name. Wat.

Overall, itâ€™s a neat story. If I didnâ€™t know the Ultimate line was nearly over, Iâ€™d be intrigued. So it goes.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Wolverine: Legacies
item.description:
Cool.

Jimmy gets a hidden message in that hidden message with his father.

Enough to reveal a tiny bit of Wolverineâ€™s past, how Jimmy came to be (almost graphically), and who his mother/family isâ€¦

Why does everyone have to be related?

As a one off, meh. In the greater storyline, too late.

Skip-able, unless youâ€™re going for completion.

item.title: Ultimate Comics: X-Men, by Brian Wood, Volume 1
item.description:
So here we go again again (again?). Another Volume 1.

It could have been an interesting story. The Mutant Cure. The last 20 or so mutants (in the US/public). Divisions even among them. A Mutant Seed that can cure world hunger.

But itâ€™s all moving so fast I barely even have a chance to get to know anyone we didnâ€™t already know. And those left feel different.

If this has been the start of Ultimate X-Men, opening with Ultimatum? That would have been cool. As it is? Meh.

Almost to the end. Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Ultimates by Sam Humphries, Vol. 1
item.description:
President Cap. Hydra. Fury doing Fury things.

Itâ€™s certainly a jam packed volumeâ€¦ but for all that happens, what has actually changed?

Feels like theyâ€™re trying to reboot a reboot while holding together entirely too much damage they (the writers) have done to this version of the universe.

Overall: itâ€™s fine, but Iâ€™m not surprised that this line doesnâ€™t last long. Being yet another Volume 1 doesnâ€™t help. Onward!

Side note: Cap is a terrible President. ðŸ˜ƒ

item.title: Ultimate Comics Spider-Man by Brian Michael Bendis, Volume 4
item.description:
Miles is new on the jobâ€”and already too many people know (or suspect that heâ€™s Spider-Man).

I do like this Jameson.

Unfortunately, that list includes Venom.

So now weâ€™ve got to deal with the tragic origin part of Spider-Man stories.

Oy.

item.title: Ultimate Comics Spider-Man by Brian Michael Bendis, Volume 3
item.description: Unless I misread something, this is included as 1/3 of Ultimate Comics: Divided We Fall, United We Stand, for the most part overlapping with that story: the fall and rise of America in this crazy Ultimate Universe. But here, we also get a lot more of the story of Miles and Uncle Aaron. Which is a bit more violent and brutal (and quick) than in Into the Spider-Verse (I think? I might be misremembering), since he’s the main protagonist.

item.title: Ultimate Comics: Divided We Fall, United We Stand
item.description: Things are â€¦ slightly more broken then I realized.

item.title: Spider-Men
item.description:
â™« Spider-Man. Spider-Man. â™«

Now we have TWO Spider-Men.

Itâ€™s another part of what became Into the Spider-Verse, with another Peter Parker getting shot across dimensions and meeting Miles.

Itâ€™s good fun all around. Iâ€™m glad to see the two get a chance to meet. And Iâ€™m going to have to check out some main universe Spider-Man at some point!

And I do wonderâ€¦ whatâ€™s Fury going to do now that he knows about parallel realitiesâ€¦ or apparently what Stark might do.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics: X-Men, Volume 2
item.description:
Flooded New York. Blew up DC. Wiped out large chucks of Europe. Sentinels on the loose.

I feel like itâ€™s just so much diverging, so many deathsâ€¦ at some point it just doesnâ€™t land any more.

I suppose weâ€™re building up to another big event, but at this point, Iâ€™m mostly waiting to see how it all ends.

item.title: Ultimate Comics Ultimates by Jonathan Hickman, Vol. 2
item.description:
Well that escalated againâ€™ly.

Given the number of sudden super powered threats, itâ€™s not over surprising. But in a world reelingâ€¦ Iâ€™m doubtful weâ€™ll get the gravitas this deserves.

A lot certainly happens, but I find it hard to be invested in any of it. Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Spider-Man, Volume 2
item.description:
Miles coming into his own.

Old enemies are thrilled to have Spider-Man back. Wisecracks and all.

New ones? More of a mixed bag. Iâ€™m enjoying this Prowler even more than the Intro the Spider-Verse version.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics: X-Men, Volume 1
item.description: â€¦ So mutants? Not in a great place after Magnetoâ€™s wave. The ones that are left are on the run and there are more than a few factions teeing to hunt them down. And as if that werenâ€™t enough, add in the new forces in SEAR. And others. Oh itâ€™s a wonderful mess. Dark. But it has potential. Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Hawkeye
item.description:
So Hawkeye.

Heâ€™s been around this whole timeâ€¦ and only sort of in the spotlight. Which I suppose us par for the course for him.

Itâ€™s interesting getting a bit more about what else was going on right when Reed came back.

Even if itâ€™s weird to have both happening at once.

Itâ€™s a fine story. Justâ€¦ fine.

item.title: Ultimate Comics Ultimates by Jonathan Hickman, Vol. 1
item.description:
And so weâ€™re back with the Ultimatesâ€¦

â€¦ and things are going very. very sideways.

Because thereâ€™s a new* villain in town.

This should be interesting.

item.title: Miles Morales: Ultimate Spider-Man
item.description:
Miles Morales!

I did not realize that he originally came from the Ultimates universe. So this is actually a new origin story!

Pretty cool. Itâ€™s interesting seeing what made it into Into the Spider-Verseâ€”and what didnâ€™t.

I do wish weâ€™d had a chance to see Peter and Miles interact more, but I think this will work out. Itâ€™s got a lot of potential.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Spider-Man: Death of Spider-Man Fallout
item.description:
I feel like weâ€™ve been here before.

But this time around, as much as it is about endingsâ€¦ itâ€™s also about new beginnings (see below, spoilers). Which is kind of a bummer. We really needed more time to breath and process, but this all feels like setting up whatever comes next.

Still, Iâ€™m looking forward to it.

Onward.

item.title: Ultimate Comics Avengers Vs. New Ultimates: Death of Spider-man
item.description:
Danvers and the Ultimates vs Fury and the Avengers.

Man thatâ€™s a mess.

Worth the read. Theyâ€™re finally hitting their stride on more Ultimate Universe titles than Spider-Man. Which I suppose they had better beâ€¦

Onward!

item.title: Death of Spider-Man
item.description:
Death of Spider-Man.

So. Is he finally going to hang up the mask for good? (again) A metaphorical sort of death?

Or, given that it’s the Ultimate Marvel Universe… is Peter Parker himself the next on chopping block?

Oy.

Of all the Ultimate Marvel titles, Ultimate Spider-Man (continued) has been by far the most consistently good. Often great. He’s a good kid and consistently tries to do his best.

Well worth the read.

item.title: Death of Spider-Man Prelude
item.description:
Oh Peter.

All that time living a double life and causing absolute chaos along the wayâ€¦

We all know whatâ€™s coming. Itâ€™s in the title for crying out loud.

But for once, itâ€™s nice to see things sort of working out.

item.title: Ultimate Comics Avengers, Vol. 3: Blade vs. The Avengers
item.description:
Youâ€™ve heard of Marvel Zombies? Well if that wasnâ€™t terrifying enoughâ€¦ what about Marvel Vampires!

Itâ€™s actually a really neat story. Blade shows up, so vampires are real. Only this time around, theyâ€™ve figured out that turning Super Vampires might just be their big shot.

Neat idea. Solid execution. A few more deaths. Marvel Ultimate yo.

By far my favorite Ultimate Avengers so far.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Thor
item.description:
Ultimate Thor. Ages ago, in Asgard. Decades ago, attacked by Nazis. And not that long ago, having a conversation with Dr. Blakeâ€”an old friend?

Itâ€™s not a bad story, although it feels weird as both a stand-alone and where it is in the Ultimate universe. What with Thor dead in Ultimatum and all.

Or is heâ€¦

item.title: Ultimate Comics Captain America
item.description:
Well thatâ€™s a thing.

No matter the universe, Marvel seems chock full of Super Soldiers. Hereâ€™s one more.

Given the subject matter, it could have used a bit more nuance. A bit more time to breathe. Captain America represents what America could have/should have been. Vietnam is anything but.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Doomsday
item.description:
It hasnâ€™t been that long since Magneto and the Ultimatum wave killed millions. But apparently long enough.

So now another threat is popping out of nowhere and wrecking just about everyone. Time for those left to save the dayâ€¦ yet again.

I always knew that Reed Richards was up to no good. Perhaps not intentionally, but that much brains combined with a seemingly complete inability to know when something is too muchâ€¦ not a great combination.

Itâ€™s fine. Not great. Not terrible.

Onward.

item.title: Chameleons
item.description:
Well thatâ€™s a fun hodge podge. Nova (remember the Watchers choosing someone? Me neither)! Spider-Woman! Kitty on the run!

And then finallyâ€¦ Chameleons!

Thereâ€™s going to be some fallout from this one.

Onward.

item.title: Ultimate Comics Avengers, Vol. 2: Crime and Punishment
item.description:
In the Ultimates universe, the Avengers are the team that takes the dirty jobs.

Like, apparently, teaming up with the Punisher (temporarily) and a proto Hulk gang boss (not sure why) against Ghost Rider?

Thatâ€™s certainly a thing.

Itâ€™s the kind of story where no one wins and Iâ€™m not really sure the point.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Avengers, Vol. 1: Next Generation
item.description:
Captain Americanâ€™s back. With a bit of unexpected past come to haunt him.

Now we need a new team to bring him in.

Introducing: the Avengers! This time around the BlackOps version of the Ultimates. And oh thatâ€™s a team. Hawkeye, a new drugged up bug girl, a new Widow, War Machine (transformers style), Nerd-Hulk (seriously), and another Starkâ€”with issues all his own.

This canâ€™t possibly go wellâ€¦

Onward!

item.title: The World According to Peter Parker
item.description:
Today, Peter is dating Gwen Stacy instead of Mary Jane and working at a mall food court instead of the now defunct Daily Bugle. Mutants are outlawed and the growing threat of the mysterious Mysterio takes the life of the once untouchable Kingpin of crime.

All that and after all these months, Johnny Storm, aka the Human Torch, reappears at Peter’s doorstep, exhausted and homeless.

Well thatâ€™s a switch. Especially considering at first everyone thought him deadâ€¦ but I suppose in this case at least we never actually saw the body.

Yes, Iâ€™m aware of the irony, given for example Gwen.

It’s fun. Making up a team of sorts? Getting back to normalcy in a seriously screwed world?

I like it. I hope we get more.

For a while at least. I can see the titles coming up.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics X: Origins
item.description:
And now, more aftermath.

Soâ€¦ theyâ€™re going to build a new team, right?

Of course they are.

Itâ€™s got potential.

Onward!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Iron Man: Armor Wars
item.description:
The worldâ€™s turned upside downâ€¦

And someone has being stealing Stark Tech.

Itâ€™s a dig into Tonyâ€™s past and thus post Ultimatum world. Pretty interesting. Curious where they go from here!

Onward.
